result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan R Slizewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be terminated after 1 year if deemed appropriate by Agent.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Not to use or possess any firearms.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the 911 caller in this incident or their residence.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Court orders weapon in this incident to be destroyed by arresting agency.  All other possessions of the defendant may be returned to him.

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation conditions for Expungement.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Ethan R Slizewski in court with Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Konrad Paczuski and Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Mcmahon makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS    -  may terminate after 1 year if deemed appropriate by agent  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;  Maintain current mental health treatment
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: 911 caller in this incident or their residence 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
____Not to use or possess any firearms


COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

NOTE:  Court orders weapon in this incident to be destroyed by arresting agency.  All other possessions of Defendant may be returned to him.     
 
**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
Sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
